uiEntry.title: tx_government
uiEntry.tooltip: The various aspects of government management are available here.||The panel itself is divided into four different tabs: national summary, policies, ministers and trade.||Each of these tabs focuses on a specific area of government.||You can change settings in some of these, whereas others are purely to provide you with information.||Move your cursor over the different sections below for more information.

uiEntry.title: tab_trade
uiEntry.tooltip: From here you can examine your imports and exports and the nations you have trade agreements with.||Mouse over the different areas to see more information.

uiEntry.title: header
uiEntry.tooltip: Current global value of resources.||Look for the resources making the most money and look to trade in them yourself.

state.title: NewState
state.tooltip: Coffee

state.title: NewState
state.tooltip: Cotton

state.title: NewState
state.tooltip: Furs

state.title: NewState
state.tooltip: Ivory

state.title: NewState
state.tooltip: Spices

state.title: NewState
state.tooltip: Sugar

state.title: NewState
state.tooltip: Tea

state.title: NewState
state.tooltip: Tobacco

uiEntry.title: heading_imports
uiEntry.tooltip: Supplies you receive through all your trade routes.||These depend on the resource slots and industrial buildings you have throughout your regions.||Move your cursor over the areas below for more information.

uiEntry.title: tx_route
uiEntry.tooltip: This displays whether the trade route is by sea or road.

uiEntry.title: tx_commodities
uiEntry.tooltip: Supplies you are receiving.||These depend on the resource slots and industrial buildings you have throughout your regions.||Some regions have more resource slots than others, you can see these on the map.||By taking regions with a lot of resource slots and developing industry there, you will improve the commodities you receive.

uiEntry.title: tx_theatre
uiEntry.tooltip: Develop trade resources to increase the flow of trade.||You can do this by taking regions with plentiful resource slots and developing your industry.

uiEntry.title: heading_exports
uiEntry.tooltip: Exports contribute to your trade income and are delivered along the trade routes you have established with other nations.||Trade routes are established by negotiating trade agreements with other nations on the Diplomacy panel.||Mouse over the different areas to see more information.

uiEntry.title: tx_nation
uiEntry.tooltip: You have made trade agreements with these nations and have established trade routes with them.||Gain more trade partners by broking trade agreements in the Diplomacy panel.

uiEntry.title: tx_route
uiEntry.tooltip: This displays whether the trade route is by sea or road.

uiEntry.title: tx_commodities
uiEntry.tooltip: These depend on the resource slots and industrial buildings you have throughout your regions.||By taking regions with a lot of resource slots and developing industry there, you will improve the commodities you export.

uiEntry.title: tx_value
uiEntry.tooltip: Income you receive from each of your exports.

uiEntry.title: total_title
uiEntry.tooltip: You can increase this number by gaining more trade partners.||Negotiating a trade agreement with a nation will open up a trade route between you.||You can do this in the Diplomacy panel.||Trade income will contribute to your overall national funds.

state.title: NewState
state.stateText: Total income from exports to trade partners:

uiEntry.title: total
uiEntry.tooltip: You can increase this number by gaining more trade partners.||Negotiating a trade agreement with a nation will open up a trade route between you.||You can do this in the Diplomacy panel.||Trade income will contribute to your overall national funds.

uiEntry.title: tab_ministers
uiEntry.tooltip: Your head of state, ministers and governors are all displayed here, along with your government's popularity.||Move your cursor over the different areas for more information.

uiEntry.title: effect1
uiEntry.tooltip: Prestige

uiEntry.title: effect2
uiEntry.tooltip: Diplomacy

uiEntry.title: effect3
uiEntry.tooltip: Ministers' effectiveness

uiEntry.title: banner
uiEntry.tooltip: Your government's head of state.||Your head of state adds bonuses to your prestige, diplomacy and economic growth.||These bonuses are dependent on the level of their management skills.||Right-click to bring up their character panel.

uiEntry.title: button_family
uiEntry.script:
local this = UIComponent(Address) local parent = UIComponent(this:Parent("government_screens"))
function OnLeftClickUp() if this:CurrentState() ~= "inactive" then parent:LuaCall("OnButtonFamily") end end

state.title: roll
state.tooltip: Show Family Tree

uiEntry.title: button_instant_election
uiEntry.tooltip: Hold instant election||If the current cabinet isn't popular with the public, they may be replaced with the opposition.||This can be useful if your current cabinet is performing badly.
uiEntry.script:
local this = UIComponent(Address) local parent = UIComponent(this:Parent("government_screens"))
function OnLeftClickUp() if this:CurrentState() ~= "inactive" then parent:LuaCall("OnButtonElections") end end

uiEntry.title: txt_popularity
uiEntry.tooltip: This is based on your public's happiness.||You can check this by examining their public order.||Public order is made up from happiness and repression.||Though repression can keep your public under control, it won't make you very popular.||The lower your popularity is, the more likely a revolt or election will oust the current administration.

uiEntry.title: popularity_arrow
uiEntry.tooltip: Popularity state||This shows whether your popularity is on the rise or dropping!

uiEntry.title: txt_next_election
uiEntry.tooltip: Next election||If you want to keep your current cabinet and your popularity is low, you only have this long to turn public opinion around!||You could try dropping tax to a low rate for a quick fix, but it may be too late.

uiEntry.title: election_turns
uiEntry.tooltip: Next election||If you want to keep your current cabinet and your popularity is low, you only have this long to turn public opinion around!||You could try dropping tax to a low rate for a quick fix, but it may be too late.

uiEntry.title: button_swap
uiEntry.script:
local this = UIComponent(Address) local parent = UIComponent(this:Parent("government_screens"))
function OnLeftClickUp() if this:CurrentState() ~= "inactive" then parent:LuaCall("ToggleMinisterSwapMode") end end

state.title: tx_absolute_monarchy
state.tooltip: The ruling classes thrive in this type of government - they will be happier and their public order will be easier to maintain.||Repression is high in an absolute monarchy.||This will be useful to help control the lower classes who are unhappier under this government.||Town wealth will grow more slowly under this rule and technological research will be more expensive, but recruitment of troops is cheaper.

state.title: tx_empire
state.tooltip: Napoleon's empire is an autocracy built upon the Republican ideals of the French Revolution.||A relatively high level of repression is sustained while clamour for reform is considerably reduced.||Both classes are granted a small boost to happiness.||The Emperor maintains absolute control over his servants in government.

state.title: tx_constitutional_monarchy
state.tooltip: Both classes gain a small boost to happiness in a constitutional monarchy.||Clamour for reform is less than in an absolute monarchy, but certain elements will always crave a Republic.

state.title: tx_republic
state.tooltip: This type of government has the biggest positive effect on your economic growth.||Clamour for reform is greatly reduced, but the repression factor in a republic is low - if you don't keep your population happy riots are likely to happen! ||Maintaining positive diplomatic relations with monarchies may prove difficult.

uiEntry.title: tx_cabinet
uiEntry.tooltip: These ministers add bonuses to various areas of your nation depending on their management skill.||You can swap posts between ministers by dragging and dropping one portrait over another in the cabinet.||You may wish to do this if one of them is incompetent in their current post.||On the other hand it may be because they are better suited to another post.||A minister's competency will not change when re-assigned, so this is more moving the problem where it will cause the least damage.

uiEntry.title: button_kick
uiEntry.tooltip: Fire minister||Use this to fire a useless minister from his position on the cabinet.||Be warned however - he may be replaced by someone even worse!||If you are in an absolute monarchy the minister will be placed by one the candidates at the bottom of this tab.
uiEntry.script:
local this = UIComponent(Address) local parent = UIComponent(this:Parent("government_screens"))
function OnLeftClickUp() if this:CurrentState() ~= "inactive" then parent:LuaCall("OnButtonKick") end end

state.title: inactive
state.tooltip: Fire minister || You must select a minister to access this button.

uiEntry.title: post_prime_minister
uiEntry.tooltip: Head of government||He adds bonuses to your prestige, diplomacy and economic growth.||The level of these are dependent on his management competence.||Right-click on his portrait to bring up his details panel.

uiEntry.title: post_finance
uiEntry.tooltip: Finance minister||He affects your tax and trade efficiency and your economic growth.||The level of these are dependent on his management competence.||Right-click on his portrait to bring up his details panel.

uiEntry.title: post_justice
uiEntry.tooltip: Justice minister||He affects your public order by adding bonuses to repression, garrisons effect and town watch costs.||The level of these bonuses are dependent on his management skill.||If he is incompetent you may wish to swap him for another minister.||He will carry his incompetence to his new post, but perhaps he will do less damage there!||Right-click on his portrait to bring up his details panel.

uiEntry.title: post_army
uiEntry.tooltip: Army minister||He affects your military costs by adding bonuses to unit recruitment and upkeep costs.||The level of these bonuses are dependent on his management skill.||Right-click on his portrait to bring up his details panel.

uiEntry.title: post_navy
uiEntry.tooltip: Navy minister||He affects your naval costs by adding bonuses to ship recruitment and upkeep costs.||The level of these bonuses are dependent on his management skill.||Right-click on his portrait to bring up his details panel.

state.title: america
state.tooltip: Governor for America||This man looks after your nation's interests for your regions in America.||He affects your tax income, repression and army upkeep cost for this theatre by adding bonuses.||Right-click on his portrait to bring up his details panel.

state.title: europe
state.tooltip: Governor for Europe||This man looks after your nation's interests for your regions in Europe.||He affects your tax income, repression and army upkeep cost for this theatre by adding bonuses.||Right-click on his portrait to bring up his details panel.

state.title: india
state.tooltip: Governor for India||This man looks after your nation's interests for your regions in India.||He affects your tax income, repression and army upkeep cost for this theatre by adding bonuses.||Right-click on his portrait to bring up his details panel.

state.title: america
state.tooltip: Governor for America||This man looks after your nation's interests for your regions in America.||He affects your tax income, repression and army upkeep cost for this theatre by adding bonuses.||Right-click on his portrait to bring up his details panel.

state.title: europe
state.tooltip: Governor for Europe||This man looks after your nation's interests for your regions in Europe.||He affects your tax income, repression and army upkeep cost for this theatre by adding bonuses.||Right-click on his portrait to bring up his details panel.

state.title: india
state.tooltip: Governor for India||This man looks after your nation's interests for your regions in India.||He affects your tax income, repression and army upkeep cost for this theatre by adding bonuses.||Right-click on his portrait to bring up his details panel.

state.title: america
state.tooltip: Governor for America||This man looks after your nation's interests for your regions in America.||He affects your tax income, repression and army upkeep cost for this theatre by adding bonuses.||Right-click on his portrait to bring up his details panel.

state.title: europe
state.tooltip: Governor for Europe||This man looks after your nation's interests for your regions in Europe.||He affects your tax income, repression and army upkeep cost for this theatre by adding bonuses.||Right-click on his portrait to bring up his details panel.

state.title: india
state.tooltip: Governor for India||This man looks after your nation's interests for your regions in India.||He affects your tax income, repression and army upkeep cost for this theatre by adding bonuses.||Right-click on his portrait to bring up his details panel.

uiEntry.tooltip: Tax Efficiency

uiEntry.title: effect2
uiEntry.tooltip: Repression

uiEntry.title: effect3
uiEntry.tooltip: Army Upkeep Cost

state.title: north_america
state.tooltip: Governor for America||This man looks after your nation's interests for your regions in America.||He affects your tax income, repression and army upkeep cost for this theatre by adding bonuses.||Right-click on his portrait to bring up his details panel.

state.title: europe
state.tooltip: Governor for Europe||This man looks after your nation's interests for your regions in Europe.||He affects your tax income, repression and army upkeep cost for this theatre by adding bonuses.||Right-click on his portrait to bring up his details panel.

state.title: india
state.tooltip: Governor for India||This man looks after your nation's interests for your regions in India.||He affects your tax income, repression and army upkeep cost for this theatre by adding bonuses.||Right-click on his portrait to bring up his details panel.

uiEntry.tooltip: Tax Efficiency

uiEntry.tooltip: Repression

uiEntry.tooltip: Army Upkeep Cost

state.title: north_america
state.tooltip: Governor for America||This man looks after your nation's interests for your regions in America.||He affects your tax income, repression and army upkeep cost for this theatre by adding bonuses.||Right-click on his portrait to bring up his details panel.

state.title: europe
state.tooltip: Governor for Europe||This man looks after your nation's interests for your regions in Europe.||He affects your tax income, repression and army upkeep cost for this theatre by adding bonuses.||Right-click on his portrait to bring up his details panel.

state.title: india
state.tooltip: Governor for India||This man looks after your nation's interests for your regions in India.||He affects your tax income, repression and army upkeep cost for this theatre by adding bonuses.||Right-click on his portrait to bring up his details panel.

state.title: appointees
state.tooltip: If you fire any of your ministers from the cabinet, their posts will be filled by one of the candidates below.||Candidates will only appear if your nation is an absolute monarchy.

state.title: opposition
state.tooltip: If there is an election the opposition could replace your current cabinet.||This could be beneficial, as they may have stronger managerial skills and add more bonuses to their various areas.||Elections are held regularly, or you can click on the hold instant election button in the top-right.

uiEntry.title: tab_taxes
uiEntry.tooltip: Each of your regions are taxed on their wealth and this goes towards your nation's income.||From this tab you can set your tax levels.||You can also view details of your taxes and their effects here.||Move your cursor over the sections below for more details.

state.title: ruler_and_cabinet
state.tooltip: Your nation is overseen by your ruler and his cabinet.||You can view details about your government on the ministers tab.

state.title: governor
state.tooltip: If this is not your home theatre, it will be overseen by a governor rather than a ruler and cabinet.||Mouse over your governor to see the bonuses he adds to this theatre.|| Right-click on this portrait to bring up his character details panel.

state.title: tooltip_amanage_on
state.tooltip: Tax rates are currently being automanaged for you, aiming for the best balance between healthy tax income, avoiding public unrest, and allowing your region's economies to grow.||Uncheck this box to set tax rates yourself (manually).

state.title: tooltip_amanage_off
state.tooltip: You are currently controlling the tax rates directly.||Check this box to automanage taxes.||Tax rates will be set for you, aiming for the best balance of healthy tax income, avoiding public unrest, and allowing your region's economies to grow.

uiEntry.title: checkbox
uiEntry.script:
local this = UIComponent(Address) local parent = UIComponent(this:Parent("government_screens"))
function NotifySelected() parent:LuaCall("Notify", Address, Component.Call("CurrentState")) end

state.title: normal
state.tooltip: Manually managing taxes||Click to automanage taxes.

state.title: selected_down_off
state.tooltip: Automanaging taxes||Click to manually manage taxes.

state.title: roll
state.tooltip: Manually managing taxes||Click to automanage taxes.

state.title: down_off
state.tooltip: Manually managing taxes||Click to automanage taxes.

state.title: selected
state.tooltip: Automanaging taxes||Click to manually manage taxes.

state.title: selected_down
state.tooltip: Manually managing taxes||Click to automanage taxes.

state.title: down
state.tooltip: Automanaging taxes||Click to manually manage taxes.

state.title: inactive
state.tooltip: Automanaging taxes||Click to manually manage taxes.

uiEntry.title: tx_construction
uiEntry.tooltip: If this box is checked construction will be managed automatically.

uiEntry.title: checkbox
uiEntry.script:
local this = UIComponent(Address) local parent = UIComponent(this:Parent("government_screens"))
function NotifySelected() parent:LuaCall("Notify", Address, Component.Call("CurrentState")) end

uiEntry.title: dy_build-policy
uiEntry.tooltip: Build policy||When construction is being managed automatically, the buildings constructed will depend on your build policy.||Use the arrows to the left and right to select different build policies.

uiEntry.title: arrow_L
uiEntry.tooltip: Next build policy
uiEntry.script:
local this = UIComponent(Address) local parent = UIComponent(this:Parent("government_screens"))
function OnLeftClickUp() parent:LuaCall("SelectPrevBuildPolicy") end

uiEntry.title: arrow_R
uiEntry.tooltip: Previous build policy
uiEntry.script:
local this = UIComponent(Address) local parent = UIComponent(this:Parent("government_screens"))
function OnLeftClickUp() parent:LuaCall("SelectNextBuildPolicy") end

uiEntry.title: tx_theatre
uiEntry.tooltip: Currently selected theatre||Each theatre has its own tax settings.

uiEntry.title: dy_theatre
uiEntry.tooltip: Currently selected theatre||Each theatre has its own tax settings.||Use the arrows to the left and right of the theatre banner to switch theatres.

uiEntry.title: effect1
uiEntry.tooltip: Tax Efficiency

uiEntry.title: effect2
uiEntry.tooltip: Repression

uiEntry.title: effect3
uiEntry.tooltip: Land Upkeep Cost

uiEntry.title: tx_levels
uiEntry.tooltip: Set tax levels using the sliders below.||These tax levels will be set across all regions.||Each region will use these tax levels along with other factors to calculate its tax income.||Taxes have different effects on the different classes, so the tax levels for the two classes are set separately by the two sliders below.||Move your cursor over the two sliders for more information.

uiEntry.title: Effects
uiEntry.tooltip: The icons below show the effects your current tax level settings are having on the two classes. || High taxes will reduce economic growth for both classes and make them unhappier.||As you move the tax level sliders you will notice that the effects change accordingly.|| Move your cursor over the icons to see the specific values of each effect.

uiEntry.title: Income
uiEntry.tooltip: Tax incomes from the lower and ruling classes.||As you move the tax sliders these numbers will reflect the changes.

uiEntry.title: button_public-order lowest
uiEntry.tooltip: If you click this button it will bring up the region's settlement details.||The region settlement panel has details on the causes of low public order in the bottom section of the panel.||Many things can cause low public order, but lowering the tax can help.||If the tax seems low enough already you might want to try increasing repression by recruiting more town watch in the area.||Clicking on this button again will dismiss the region settlement panel.
uiEntry.script:
dofile "data/ui/templates/template.fe_button_standard.lua"
local this = UIComponent(Address) local root = UIComponent(this:Parent("government_screens"))
function OnSelect() root:LuaCall("OpenLowestPublicOrderRegionDetails") end

uiEntry.title: dy_total
uiEntry.tooltip: This money will be added to your funds next turn.||It is the total tax income for your nation.||Changing any of the tax level sliders will affect this number.

uiEntry.title: dy_income_upper
uiEntry.tooltip: Total ruling class tax income. ||Changing the ruling class tax level sliders will affect this number.

uiEntry.title: slider
uiEntry.tooltip: Ruling class tax slider||Move to the left to decrease and to the right to increase the tax level for the ruling classes.||As you move these sliders the tax effects, income and map will update to reflect your changes.

uiEntry.title: handle
uiEntry.tooltip: Ruling class tax slider||Move to the left to decrease and to the right to increase the tax level for the ruling classes.||As you move these sliders the tax effects, income and map will update to reflect your changes.

uiEntry.title: dy_income_lower
uiEntry.tooltip: Total lower class tax income.||Changing the lower class tax level sliders will affect this number.

uiEntry.title: slider
uiEntry.tooltip: Lower class tax slider.||Move to the left to decrease and to the right to increase the tax level for the lower classes.||As you move these sliders the tax effects, income and map will update to reflect your changes.

uiEntry.title: handle
uiEntry.tooltip: Lower class tax slider.||Move to the left to decrease and to the right to increase the tax level for the lower classes.||As you move these sliders the tax effects, income and map will update to reflect your changes.

uiEntry.title: Map panel
uiEntry.tooltip: Taxes map||This provides an overall idea of how taxes are affecting your population's happiness.||Mousing over the map will tell you what the region is called and which nation owns it.||Your regions are shown in red, green or yellow.||If a region is green it means the population's public order is under control; red means that they are close to rioting!||Tax levels affect a population's happiness, and as a result, their public order level.||Lowering tax levels will help calm rioting or unhappy regions.||Instead of lowering tax levels you could add more militia presence in problem regions to increase oppression.

uiEntry.title: map
uiEntry.tooltip: Taxes map||This provides an overall idea of how taxes are affecting your population's happiness.||Mousing over the map will tell you what the region is called and which nation owns it.||Your regions are shown in red, green or yellow.||If a region is green it means the population's public order is under control; red means that they are close to rioting!||Tax levels affect a population's happiness, and as a result, their public order level.||Lowering tax levels will help calm rioting or unhappy regions.||Instead of lowering tax levels you could add more militia presence in problem regions to increase oppression.

uiEntry.title: map
uiEntry.tooltip: Taxes map||This provides an overall idea of how taxes are affecting your population's happiness.||Mousing over the map will tell you what the region is called and which nation owns it.||Your regions are shown in red, green or yellow.||If a region is green it means the population's public order is under control; red means that they are close to rioting!||Tax levels affect a population's happiness, and as a result, their public order level.||Lowering tax levels will help calm rioting or unhappy regions.||Instead of lowering tax levels you could add more militia presence in problem regions to increase oppression.

uiEntry.title: map
uiEntry.tooltip: Taxes map||This provides an overall idea of how taxes are affecting your population's happiness.||Mousing over the map will tell you what the region is called and which nation owns it.||Your regions are shown in red, green or yellow.||If a region is green it means the population's public order is under control; red means that they are close to rioting!||Tax levels affect a population's happiness, and as a result, their public order level.||Lowering tax levels will help calm rioting or unhappy regions.||Instead of lowering tax levels you could add more militia presence in problem regions to increase oppression.

uiEntry.title: map
uiEntry.tooltip: Taxes map||This provides an overall idea of how taxes are affecting your population's happiness.||Mousing over the map will tell you what the region is called and which nation owns it.||Your regions are shown in red, green or yellow.||If a region is green it means the population's public order is under control; red means that they are close to rioting!||Tax levels affect a population's happiness, and as a result, their public order level.||Lowering tax levels will help calm rioting or unhappy regions.||Instead of lowering tax levels you could add more militia presence in problem regions to increase oppression.

uiEntry.title: button_zoom
uiEntry.tooltip: Toggle zoom
uiEntry.script:
local this = UIComponent(Address) local parent = UIComponent(this:Parent("government_screens"))
function OnLeftClickUp() parent:LuaCall("ToggleZoom") end

uiEntry.title: tab_title
uiEntry.tooltip: Each of your regions are taxed on their wealth and this goes towards your nation's income.||From this tab you can set your tax levels.||Each different theatre has its own tax level.||You can also view details of your taxes and their effects here.||Move your cursor over the sections below for more details.

uiEntry.title: tab_national_summary
uiEntry.tooltip: This provides you with an overall picture of your nation, along with specific information about your diplomatic and financial standings.||Move your cursor over the areas below for more details.

state.title: tx_monarch
state.tooltip: The leader of your nation||Your leader's abilities and traits will help shape your nation's future, good or bad.||They can add a bonus or penalty to minister management.||Right-click on their portrait to bring up their character panel, or find out more on their governing abilities on the ministers tab.

state.title: tx_president
state.tooltip: The leader of your nation||Their abilities and traits will help shape your nation's future, good or bad.||Right-click on their portrait to bring up the character panel, or find out more on their governing abilities on the ministers tab.

state.title: tx_emperor
state.tooltip: The leader of your nation||Their abilities and traits will help shape your nation's future, good or bad.||Right-click on their portrait to bring up the character panel, or find out more on their governing abilities on the ministers tab.

uiEntry.title: tx_government
uiEntry.tooltip: Each government type has its own distinct effect - happiness, diplomacy and economic factors will all behave differently according to which type is in power.||To find out more about your government see the ministers tab and mouse over your government's type.

uiEntry.title: dy_government
uiEntry.tooltip: Each government type has its own distinct effect - happiness, diplomacy and economic factors will all behave differently according to which type is in power.||To find out more about your government see the ministers tab and mouse over your government's type.

uiEntry.title: tx_state-religion
uiEntry.tooltip: State religion is determined by your nation's leader.||Individual regions have their own religion and their happiness may be affected if it differs from the state's.||Nations with the same religion will find common ground together and are more likely to get on.||This is an important factor when engaging in diplomacy.

uiEntry.title: dy_state-religion
uiEntry.tooltip: State religion is determined by your nation's leader.||Individual regions have their own religion and their happiness may be affected if it differs from the state's.||Nations with the same religion will find common ground together and are more likely to get on.||This is an important factor when engaging in diplomacy.

uiEntry.title: tx_home-region
uiEntry.tooltip: This is your nation's capital.

uiEntry.title: dy_home-region
uiEntry.tooltip: This is your nation's capital.

state.title: NewState
state.stateText: Fort Pontchartrain du Detroit, Confederation of New England

uiEntry.title: tx_treasury
uiEntry.tooltip: Your treasury is the total sum of money you have available to spend on building and recruitment for this turn.||The projected income section shows how much income will be added to this treasury next turn.

uiEntry.title: dy_treasury
uiEntry.tooltip: Your treasury is the total sum of money you have available to spend on building and recruitment for this turn.||The projected income section shows how much income will be added to this treasury next turn.

uiEntry.title: tx_population
uiEntry.tooltip: This is the population of your nation across all your regions.

uiEntry.title: dy_population
uiEntry.tooltip: This is the population of your nation across all your regions.

uiEntry.title: tx_prosperity
uiEntry.tooltip: This shows how wealthy your nation is compared to other nations.

uiEntry.title: dy_prosperity
uiEntry.tooltip: This shows how wealthy your nation is compared to other nations.

uiEntry.title: tx_prestige
uiEntry.tooltip: Your prestige depends on how you measure up against other nations.||It is a reflection of your achievements during your campaign.||Your conquests will improve your prestige, as well as research in the technologies.||Your total prestige points will be calculated at the end of your campaign and you can see where you stand compared to the other nations.

uiEntry.title: dy_prestige
uiEntry.tooltip: Your prestige depends on how you measure up against other nations.||It is a reflection of your achievements during your campaign.||Your conquests will improve your prestige, as well as research in the technologies.||Your total prestige points will be calculated at the end of your campaign and you can see where you stand compared to the other nations.

uiEntry.title: finances
uiEntry.tooltip: Your regular incomings and outgoings are detailed here.||The total income for the next turn is totalled at the bottom of this panel.||Move your cursor over the details below for more information.

uiEntry.title: heading_finances
uiEntry.tooltip: Your regular incomings and outgoings are detailed here.||The total income for the next turn is totalled at the bottom of this panel.||Move your cursor over the details below for more information.

uiEntry.title: tx_income
uiEntry.tooltip: Income gained from taxing the wealth of all your regions.||This number is based on your current tax settings.||If you change the tax levels before the next turn this will change accordingly.||To change tax levels, and to see more information on your taxes, see the tax tab of this panel.||To see each region's individual tax details, view the region capital's settlement details panel.

state.title: NewState
state.tooltip: This is the income you gain from taxing the wealth of all your regions.

uiEntry.title: dy_tax-income
uiEntry.tooltip: Income gained from taxing the wealth of all your regions.||This number is based on your current tax settings.||If you change the tax levels before the next turn this will change accordingly.||To change tax levels, and to see more information on your taxes, see the tax tab of this panel.||To see each region's individual tax details, view the region capital's settlement details panel.

state.title: NewState
state.tooltip: This is the income you gain from taxing the wealth of all your regions.

uiEntry.title: tx_trade
uiEntry.tooltip: Income gained from exporting your nation's resources to your trade partners via trade routes.||Throughout your regions you will have trade resources such as sugar, coffee and tobacco.||These are shipped in to your region's capital.||If the trade supply exceeds the demand, the surplus is exported through international trade routes to your trade partners.||To increase this income develop trade resources and make more trade partners.||You can see a breakdown of your supply and exports in the trade tab of this panel.

uiEntry.title: dy_trade
uiEntry.tooltip: Income gained from exporting your nation's resources to your trade partners via trade routes.||Throughout your regions you will have trade resources such as sugar, coffee and tobacco.||These are shipped in to your region's capital.||If the trade supply exceeds the demand, the surplus is exported through international trade routes to your trade partners.||To increase this income develop trade resources and make more trade partners.||You can see a breakdown of your supply and exports in the trade tab of this panel.

uiEntry.title: tx_other
uiEntry.tooltip: Income gained from other sources such as payments from diplomatic negotiations and protectorates.

uiEntry.title: dy_other
uiEntry.tooltip: Income gained from other sources such as payments from diplomatic negotiations and protectorates.

uiEntry.title: tx_upkeep_army
uiEntry.tooltip: Amount of money per turn to support your armies.||Disband units to reduce this figure.||Armies are made up of units.||Each unit has an upkeep cost in its unit details panel.||Units that are not doing anything are simply wasting money.||Disband them or move them where they are needed.

uiEntry.title: dy_army-upkeep
uiEntry.tooltip: Amount of money per turn to support your armies.||Disband units to reduce this figure.||Armies are made up of units.||Each unit has an upkeep cost in its unit details panel.||Units that are not doing anything are simply wasting money.||Disband them or move them where they are needed.

uiEntry.title: tx_upkeep_navy
uiEntry.tooltip: Amount of money per turn to support your naval fleets.||Disband ships to reduce this figure.||Fleets are made up of ships.||Each ship has an upkeep cost in its ship details panel.||Ships that are not doing anything are wasting money.||Disband them or move them where they will be useful.

uiEntry.title: dy_navy-upkeep
uiEntry.tooltip: Amount of money per turn to support your naval fleets.||Disband ships to reduce this figure.||Fleets are made up of ships.||Each ship has an upkeep cost in its ship details panel.||Ships that are not doing anything are wasting money.||Disband them or move them where they will be useful.

uiEntry.title: tx_policing
uiEntry.tooltip: Amount of money per turn to support your town watch.||To keep the peace, every settlement needs militia (or town watch) to enforce public order. This is known as repression.||Public order is kept by keeping your population happy and repressing any trouble.||The more unhappy a population, the more repression you will need.||Some settlements will need less repression than others and you can disband some units to save money.||Public order details can be found in your settlement details panel.||From this you can judge how much repression is needed.

uiEntry.title: dy_policing
uiEntry.tooltip: Amount of money per turn to support your town watch.||To keep the peace, every settlement needs militia (or town watch) to enforce public order. This is known as repression.||Public order is kept by keeping your population happy and repressing any trouble.||The more unhappy a population, the more repression you will need.||Some settlements will need less repression than others and you can disband some units to save money.||Public order details can be found in your settlement details panel.||From this you can judge how much repression is needed.

uiEntry.title: tx_income_annual
uiEntry.tooltip: This will be added to your treasury next turn.||This is calculated from your incomings and outgoings as detailed above.

uiEntry.title: dy_annual-income
uiEntry.tooltip: This will be added to your treasury next turn.||This is calculated from your incomings and outgoings as detailed above.

uiEntry.title: dy_sum_credit
uiEntry.tooltip: The total of your incomings.||Your upkeep costs will be deducted from this to create your total income for the next turn.||Your tax, trade and other incomes (as detailed above) make up this sum.

uiEntry.title: dy_sum_debit
uiEntry.tooltip: The total of your outgoings.||This will be taken from your incomings to create your total income for the next turn.||Your army, naval and town watch upkeep costs make up this total.

uiEntry.title: heading_diplomacy
uiEntry.tooltip: This section displays your allies, enemies, trade partners and protectorates. || Mouse over the different areas below for more information.

uiEntry.title: tx_allies
uiEntry.tooltip: You have a military alliance with these nations.||They should come to your aid in war, especially to defend you if attacked.||They may be less willing to join you in attacking others, especially if they have good relations with your target.|| To make or break allies, or to simply see more details, see your diplomatic details panel.

uiEntry.title: Allies bar
uiEntry.tooltip: You have a military alliance with these nations.||They should come to your aid in war, especially to defend you if attacked.||They may be less willing to join you in attacking others, especially if they have good relations with your target.|| To make or break allies, or to simply see more details, see your diplomatic details panel.

uiEntry.title: tx_atwar
uiEntry.tooltip: These nations may attack you at any time - guard your territory, armies, navies and trade routes with care!||To make peace with your enemies, or to see more information, see your diplomatic details panel.

uiEntry.title: At War bar
uiEntry.tooltip: These nations may attack you at any time - guard your territory, armies, navies and trade routes with care!||To make peace with your enemies, or to see more information, see your diplomatic details panel.

uiEntry.title: tx_tradepartners
uiEntry.tooltip: The nations that you are trading with.||Your trade income comes from the resources you export to these nations via trade routes from your home region to their home region.||To find out more information on your trade, see your Trade tab. You can also make more trade relations on your diplomatic details panel.

uiEntry.title: Trade bar
uiEntry.tooltip: The nations that you are trading with.||Your trade income comes from the resources you export to these nations via trade routes from your home region to their home region.||To find out more information on your trade, see your Trade tab. You can also make more trade relations on your diplomatic details panel.

uiEntry.title: tx_protectorates
uiEntry.tooltip: These nations are under your protection.||In exchange for your protection you receive half their income and unlimited military access to their regions.

uiEntry.title: Trade bar
uiEntry.tooltip: These nations are under your protection.||In exchange for your protection you receive half their income and unlimited military access to their regions.

uiEntry.title: victory
uiEntry.tooltip: You will need to complete these to win the game.

uiEntry.title: hrading-condition
uiEntry.tooltip: You will need to complete these to win the game.

state.title: NewState
state.stateText: Hold the highest Prestige rating at the end of year 1799

uiEntry.title: tab_title
uiEntry.tooltip: This provides you with an overall picture of your nation, along with specific information about your diplomatic and financial standings.||Move your cursor over the areas below for more details.

uiEntry.title: government_screen_button_close
uiEntry.tooltip: Close
